text:
Applying `nilearn.plotting.find_xyz_cut_coords()`on the nifti attached here, a y coordinate is returned that is positive (i.e., in the anterior part of the brain) but is supposed to be negative (in the back of the brain). This bug is not observed with `nilearn.find_cut_slices()`.

[RTPJ-1.nii.zip](https://github.com/nilearn/nilearn/files/397428/RTPJ-1.nii.zip)
title: nilearn.plotting.find_xyz_cut_coords() returns the wrong coordinate
clean_text: appli nifti attach coordin return posit ie anterior part brain suppos neg back brain thi bug observ rtpj1niizip

text:
> ```
> if mask.max() == 0:
>     return .5 * np.array(data.shape)
> ```

That's a pretty bad bug!
